intro: Oberonia kusukusensis, commonly known as the Kusukus Island orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and compact growth habit. The plant typically produces small, intricately shaped flowers with a distinct coloration pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
